meanings.definition: A body of voters in a specified area who elect a representative to a legislative body.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, constituencies have different boundaries for each election.
meanings.sent2: The constituencies in our city play a crucial role in choosing our leaders.
meanings.sent3: The constituencies in the town hall meeting were very vocal about their concerns.
meanings.sent4: Her support came from diverse constituencies, making her victory even more impressive.
meanings.sent5: The power of constituencies lies in their ability to shape the future through voting.

meanings.definition: A group of people with a common interest or characteristic.
meanings.sent1: The environmental constituencies worked together to clean up the park.
meanings.sent2: She found her constituencies among fellow artists who shared her passion.
meanings.sent3: The constituencies at the book club meeting were eager to discuss the latest novel.
meanings.sent4: Their constituencies of loyal customers kept coming back for more.
meanings.sent5: The constituencies of volunteers made a significant impact on the community.
